content.description: On the far right side of the downhill side of the sap boulder start sitting on the double arete and climb to the top.  The mantle is a little slopey.  Fun.
content.location: On the flux boulder.  Hike up the ccc trail and once you reach the cliff band before the final up hill section to the flatiron head left into the talus and downhill a little.  There is a large sappy pinetree above this boulder and it provides nice shade.

content.description: A traverse on the Flux Boulder.  Sticky Arête into the far left line Dry Fired.
Sit down start with good edges and climb up corner of boulder.
content.location: Left side of boulder.  5ft left of Flux Classic on the Flux(Sap) Boulder.

content.description: The left Obvious Line on the Flux Boulder.  Start standing on the big right facing sidepull feature and climb up the technical face with cool holds to a slightly insecure topout.  In the shade most the day since a large pine tree is over the boulder.
content.location: Hike up the CCC trail and once you hit the the first cliff band head left into the talus just before doing the final steeper stairs up to the flatiron and it is in the talus on the left edge just below the Pedestal problem and underneath the big pine tree. There are a couple other really fun lines on this face too that are a little easier. Alternative and quicker approach:  From ccc trail/ grotto trail junction go west on grotto trail one hundred feet.  Go straight up hill from there 200 yards or so and you are there.  Look for the giant pine tree.

content.description: Just left of Flux Boulder Classic on the same face.  Start sitting on boulder with a slick right pinch and a left sidepull.  A couple cruxy moves gain the arête left and an easing finish.
content.location: Just left of Flux Boulder classic.

content.description: Start sitting with a left hand sidepull crimp and a right hammock on the arete. A few moves through cool and not as good as you would think holds will get you near the top, then finish it up.  A fun and safe little problem.
content.location: On the Flux Boulder, the far northwest arete. (Uphill side of the boulder.)

content.description: In the trees at the east edge of the main boulder field
